intro: Lindernia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flower lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and wetlands. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular, pink to purple flowers. It is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to periodic flooding. Lindernia parviflora is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with moist conditions.
